page.title: 07HOUSING CONDITIONS
page.content: Many of the nineteenth century homes in the Cynon Valley lacked indoor toilets and no bathrooms until quite recently.{Indeed quite a number still {lack many of the basic ammenities that {you would associate with twentieth {century housing.}A large number of residents have taken advantage of {Local Authority Housing Grants}in order to instal these basic ammenities to their homes.In fact new flat roofed extensions at the backs of houses are a common sight. There also exists the {Cynon Taff Housing Association}which buys up poor housing stock to renovate them to the necessary standard.They are then rented to various families. There is little house building taking place at present as there is a decline in the population,but there are some examples of modern houses and bungalows to be found.
